marketNews.title: Investor Qatar Enters 1 Million Home Programme
marketNews.content: The Indonesian government signed a memorandum of understanding with Qatar‑based investor Qilaa International Group on Wednesday, 8 January 2025, to build one million affordable homes for low‑income urban residents. The programme is part of the administration’s goal of constructing three million homes per year under President Prabowo Subianto’s government. Under the agreement, the government will provide land for apartment construction, prioritising the regions of Jakarta, Banten and West Java, while Qilaa International Group will act as contractor and finance the projects. The financial size and duration of the partnership have not been disclosed. In December 2024, Hashim Djojohadikusumo – head of the Housing Task Force and brother of President Prabowo – said the United Arab Emirates would also cooperate to build one million affordable homes. The announcement came one day after Housing and Settlement Minister Maruarar Sirait said he was discussing with President Prabowo and the Housing Savings Management Agency (BP Tapera) a revision of the Tapera contribution from mandatory to voluntary. Under the existing regulation, the Tapera contribution is mandatory for all workers earning above the minimum wage as of 20 May 2027, at a rate of 3 % of monthly earnings. It remains unclear whether the minister’s statement implies a future amendment of the Tapera rule. Maruarar added that the government is awaiting a Constitutional Court decision on a public lawsuit against the existing Tapera regulation. The sustainable funding from the Qatar investor could support the housing programme, potentially reducing reliance on Tapera funds. Greater certainty of the housing programme could positively affect supporting sectors such as cement ($SMGR, $INTP), ceramics ($ARNA, $CAKK) and home‑appliance makers ($ACES, $MDIY, $TOTO). Conversely, the possibility of making the Tapera contribution voluntary could ease pressure on households’ discretionary income, potentially boosting overall consumer purchasing power.

marketNews.title: Gaikindo Reports December 2024 Domestic Car Wholesales
marketNews.content: Gaikindo reported that domestic car wholesales in December 2024 reached 79,806 units, a decline of 6.4 % year‑on‑year but up 7.3 % month‑on‑month. The 12‑month total for 2024 therefore amounted to 865,723 units, a 14 % year‑on‑year decline, equal to 102 % of the revised 2024 target of 850,000 units.

marketNews.title: Indonesia Consumer Confidence Index Rises to 127.7 in December 2024
marketNews.content: Indonesia’s consumer‑confidence index rose to 127.7 in December 2024, up from 125.9 in November 2024, marking the highest level since April 2024. The increase was driven by gains across all sub‑indices.

marketNews.title: China CPI Slows to 0.1 % YoY in December 2024
marketNews.content: China’s National Bureau of Statistics reported that the consumer price index (CPI) eased to 0.1 % year‑on‑year in December 2024 (down from 0.2 % in November), the lowest level since March 2024 and indicating a rising deflation risk despite stimulus measures and accommodative monetary policy. On a monthly basis the CPI was flat (‑0.6 % month‑on‑month). Core inflation in December 2024 was 0.4 % year‑on‑year, versus 0.3 % in November.

marketNews.title: Indonesia to Extend Minimum Tenor for Export‑Earnings Placement to One Year
marketNews.content: Economy Minister Airlangga Hartarto said on Wednesday, 8 January 2025, that the government will amend the minimum tenor for the placement of foreign‑exchange earnings from natural‑resource exports (DHE SDA) from three months to one year. He did not specify whether the required minimum share of export value will change from the current 30 % for exporters with at least US$250,000 in export value. He added that the government and Bank Indonesia are preparing incentives related to the rule change, but gave no further details. The announcement came less than a week after a Kontan report that the government would raise the minimum share and tenor of DHE SDA placement from 30 % for three months to a minimum of 50 % for six‑to‑12 months, with an interest incentive of up to 4.48 %.

marketNews.title: Macquarie Projects Potential 35 % Cut in Global Nickel Supply
marketNews.content: Macquarie Group Ltd. on Wednesday, 8 January, estimated that a potential cut in Indonesian nickel ore production could reduce global nickel supply by 35 %, posing a risk of a sharp price increase. Earlier, Bloomberg had reported that the Indonesian government was considering cutting the nickel ore quota from 272 million tonnes in 2024 to 150 million tonnes in 2025. Macquarie judged such a large cut unlikely, but noted that lower Indonesian output could still raise prices.

marketNews.title: Indonesia Encourages Import of Breeding Cattle for School‑Meal Programme
marketNews.content: Agriculture Deputy Minister Sudaryono said on Wednesday, 8 January, that the government is encouraging domestic cattle breeders to import breeding cattle to supply meat and milk for the free‑lunch school programme, targeting 400,000 head in 2025, half of which should be dairy cattle. The government also aims to import two million breeding cattle by 2029 to meet future school‑lunch demand, though no specific incentives were disclosed.

marketNews.title: Sejahteraraya Anugrahjaya Plans Rp 1 Trillion Capex in 2025
marketNews.content: Sejahteraraya Anugrahjaya (SRAJ) announced that it will allocate a capital expenditure of Rp 1 trillion in 2025, double the Rp 500 billion allocated in 2024. The funds will be used to complete construction of several hospitals, including Mayapada Hospital Jakarta Timur, the expansion of Tower 3 at Mayapada Hospital Jakarta Selatan, and Mayapada Apollo Batam International Hospital. No performance targets for 2025 were disclosed.

marketNews.title: HEAL Director Purchases 600,000 Shares
marketNews.content: Medical‑care group Hermina (HEAL) director Yulisar Khiat bought 600,000 HEAL shares at an average price of Rp 1,580 per share on 2 January 2025, a transaction worth about Rp 948 million. After the purchase, Khiat’s ownership rose from 12.761 % to 12.765 % of the company.

tickerNews.title: ASII Wholesales Toyota Down 14 % and Daihatsu Down 13 % in FY 2024
tickerNews.content: Astra International recorded wholesale sales of Toyota of 26,667 units (‑17 % YoY, ‑1.2 % month‑on‑month) in December 2024, while Daihatsu wholesales were 13,057 units (+2 % YoY, +30 % MoM). Combined, the two brands posted an 11 % YoY decline and a 7 % MoM increase in December 2024, under‑performing the industry average of ‑6 % YoY and +7 % MoM. The combined market‑share fell to 49.8 % in December 2024 (vs. 52.6 % in December 2023 and 49.8 % in November 2024). Over the full FY 2024, Toyota wholesales totaled 288,982 units (‑14 % YoY) and Daihatsu 163,032 units (‑13 % YoY).

tickerNews.title: Bukalapak Says Physical‑Product Service Termination Will Not Harm Business
tickerNews.content: Bukalapak disclosed in a filing to the Indonesia Stock Exchange that the termination of its physical‑product services on the marketplace did not harm the company’s business continuity. The company said the physical‑product segment contributed about 3 % of total revenue, and that ending the service would support the goal of achieving positive EBITDA through operating‑cost efficiency. For the first nine months of 2024, Bukalapak reported revenue of Rp 3.4 trillion, with the marketplace segment contributing Rp 1.83 trillion, and an adjusted EBITDA loss of Rp 193 billion.

tickerNews.title: Total Bangun Persada Posts Rp 5.08 Trillion New‑Contract Value in 2024
tickerNews.content: Total Bangun Persada reported a new contract value of Rp 5.08 trillion for 2024, a 21 % year‑on‑year increase and 113 % of the 2024 target of Rp 4.5 trillion. The company also has a pipeline of projects worth about Rp 7.87 trillion and targets a new‑contract value of Rp 5 trillion in 2025.

tickerNews.title: Raharja Energi Cepu Secures US$6.9 Million Loan for PJUC
tickerNews.content: Raharja Energi Cepu announced that it will provide a loan facility of approximately US$6.9 million to its subsidiary PT Petrogas Jatim Utama Cendana (PJUC), with an interest rate of SOFR + 5 % (effective 10.04 %). The loan will be used for 2025 cash‑call financing. PJUC holds a 2.2423 % participation right in the Cepu oil block.

tickerNews.title: Hero Global Investment Targets 100 MW Renewable Capacity by 2031
tickerNews.content: Hero Global Investment said it targets a total renewable‑energy capacity of 100 MW by 2031, using the proceeds of its Rp 260 billion IPO to build a 25 MW hydro‑electric plant and a 10 MW mini‑hydro plant, both expected to be commercially operational in 2028. Over the next six years the company plans to add 58 MW of hydro capacity, 8 MW of biomass, 6 MW of biogas and 10 MW of solar. Chief Financial Officer Hugo Feber Parluhutan Silalahi said the firm aims for a three‑fold increase in revenue and net profit in 2025, targeting Rp 95 billion of revenue and Rp 35 billion of net profit.

tickerNews.title: Amman Mineral Sets 2025 Copper and Gold Production Targets
tickerNews.content: Amman Mineral International said it targets production of 228 million pounds of copper and 90,000 ounces of gold in 2025, down from a revised 2024 target of 374 million pounds of copper and 751,000 ounces of gold. The company said the lower 2025 target reflects operational dynamics linked to the early phase of Phase 8 at the Batu Hijau mine, where ore grades are low to medium. The 2025 focus will be on completing the final commissioning of the copper smelter, gold‑refining facilities, a gas‑turbine power plant, an LNG plant, and expansion of the processing plant.

tickerNews.title: Garuda Indonesia Discusses Possible Merger with Pelita Air Service
tickerNews.content: Garuda Indonesia disclosed in a filing to the Indonesia Stock Exchange that it is in early‑stage discussions with parties regarding a possible merger with PT Pelita Air Service. The company did not disclose a timeline, stating that further progress will be communicated if significant developments occur. Earlier, Ministry of State‑Owned Enterprises Minister Erick Thohir said the consolidation of Garuda, Pelita Air Service and Citilink Indonesia is targeted to be completed within six months. The consolidation had previously been announced by Erick in August 2023 to reduce logistics costs.

tickerNews.title: SSIA Signs Credit‑Facility Amendment with BCA
tickerNews.content: Surya Semesta Internusa, through its subsidiary PT Suryalaya Anindita International (SAI), signed a credit‑facility amendment with Bank Central Asia (BBCA) that increases the facility by approximately Rp 1.4 trillion for a ten‑year term. Rp 1.2 trillion will be used for capex to renovate the Melia Bali Hotels & Resorts, while the remaining Rp 215 billion will finance the extension of land‑use rights for the resort.
